capabilities.name: We need to extract and process stream data in order to get real-time input for our machine-learning model.
We need to regulary extract and transform data in order to get input for our machine-learning model.
We need to extract and transform data only a few times in order to get input for our machine-learning model.
We need to consider persisted data that is very structured and has stable schemas
We need to consider persisted data that is unstructured and/or has changing schemas
We need to consider persisted data that can be flawed.
We need to consider large data sets that are very simple and only have one value per entry (e.g. sensor data).
We want to persist and analyze network data that contains relationsships between nodes.
We need to consider a large amount of files that mainly contains text.
We need to consider media files like images and videos.
We need to save additional meta data to our input files.
We need a model that distinguishes two classes on the basis of existing labeled data.
We need to distinguishe between more than two classes on the basis of existing labeled data.
We need to predict a value on the basis of different input variables and existing labeled data.
We need a predict values on the basis of non-obvious patterns in existing data.
We need a model that continiously adapts over time.
We need to a explore data sets in an interactive manner.
We need to quickly try different models in an interactive manner.
We need to train our model with large data volumes only very few times.
We need to train our model with privacy-critical data.
We need to provide evidence that the selected models performance better than alternatives.
We need to benchmark our models on a regular basis.
We need to quickly share our models source code and data in an interactive way that allows discussion and exploration.
We need to document and share our models source code and data in a structured and well defined way.
We need to share our stack to quickly allow repetition in any development environment.
We need to share our model in a packed way that can be run and integrated in other products and environments without sharing the source code.
We need to provide our model in a production-ready that can be consumed via a standardized web api.
We need to embed our model in a web-based application.
We need to know the workload of our models in production.
We need to know who is using our models.
We need insights about our model accuracy in production.
We need to extract data from various sources and asynchronily consume this data.
We need to find patterns in a network.

categories.name: Data Ingestion
categories.description: Extract and transform data from data sources

categories.name: Data Storage
categories.description: Persist data in adequate data structures

categories.name: Model Selection and Creation
categories.description: Which model seems adequate for a problem

categories.name: Model Provision and Execution
categories.description: Where to run and how to consume the model

patterns.name: Explorative Sandbox
patterns.description: We try various models in a mainly manual manner

patterns.name: Productive Factory
patterns.description: The models are part of a product and consumed for real-world services. Therefore the process have to be bullet-proof and highly reliable.

patterns.name: Supervised Learning
patterns.description: Supervised learning is the machine learning task of learning a function that maps an input to an output based on example input-output pairs. It infers a function from labeled training data consisting of a set of training examples.

patterns.name: Unsupervised Learning
patterns.description: Unsupervised learning is a type of self-organized Hebbian learning that helps find previously unknown patterns in data set without pre-existing labels. It is also known as self-organization and allows modeling probability densities of given inputs. It is one of the main three categories of machine learning, along with supervised and reinforcement learning. Semi-supervised learning has also been described, and is a hybridization of supervised and unsupervised techniques.

systems.name: Stream Processing
systems.description: Real time extraction and transformation of data.

systems.name: Batch Processing
systems.description: Regular running jobs that extract, transform and load data.

systems.name: Message Broker
systems.description: A message broker consumes various data sources and provides topic-specifc queues for upstream system.

systems.name: Relational Data Store
systems.description: Relational databases that persist data in fixed schemas and follow the idea of normalization.

systems.name: Distribute File Storage
systems.description: A distributed file system that saves massive amounts of files on various nodes in a distributed manner.

systems.name: Blob Storage
systems.description: A binary object storage that saves many large files for processing and allows to add arbitrary meta data and enhanced meta-analytics.

systems.name: NoSQL Document Store
systems.description: A database for unstructured content that is fast and allows to save data in arbitrary semi-structed schemas (XML/JSON)

systems.name: NoSQL Key-Value-Store
systems.description: A fast database that simply saves one value with a key.

systems.name: Graph Database
systems.description: A database that saves data in graph-oriented structures

systems.name: Binary Classification Model
systems.description: A classification model that distinguishes input to be either A or B

systems.name: Multiclass Classification Model
systems.description: A model that distinguishes between more than two values (e.g. Dog, Cat, Mouse, ...)

systems.name: Regression Model
systems.description: A regression model that predicts a value on the basis of existing data.

systems.name: Deep Neural Networks
systems.description: Deep neural networks (ANN) or connectionist systems are computing systems that are inspired by, but not identical to, biological neural networks that constitute animal brains. Such systems "learn" to perform tasks by considering examples, generally without being programmed with task-specific rules.

systems.name: Interactive Sandbox
systems.description: A interactive sandbox to explore data and quickly try different models and algorithms.

systems.name: Cloud-based training
systems.description: A cloud platform to train models

systems.name: On-Premise Model Training
systems.description: Model training on local machines or a local data center

systems.name: Cross Validation
systems.description: Cross-validation is any of various similar model validation techniques for assessing how the results of a statistical analysis will generalize to an independent data set. It is mainly used in settings where the goal is prediction, and one wants to estimate how accurately a predictive model will perform in practice.

systems.name: Notebooks
systems.description: Interactive web-based notebooks that present data and models

systems.name: Source Code Management
systems.description: Save source code and persist changes. Often also contains additional features like issue management, wiki and the like.

systems.name: Container / Virtual Machines
systems.description: Provision of an entire environment/stack via a container or virtual machine

systems.name: Executable Binary
systems.description: Provision of model as a executable binary without the possibility to access the source code.

systems.name: Web-Service
systems.description: Provision of the results as a (REST)-API that can be consumed via the internet.

systems.name: Model Monitoring
systems.description: A way to track calls, scaling and result accuracy.

systems.name: Manual Extraction and Cleansing
systems.description: Manual extraction and cleansing of data

systems.name: Network Analysis
systems.description: Network focused algorithms
